modules.description: Provides monadic binding and lifting operations for handling computations within a context, supporting sequential execution and value transformation. Works with parameterized types representing computational contexts, such as option, list, or custom monadic structures. Enables concise chaining of operations in effectful or asynchronous workflows.

Provides operations for creating and manipulating rational numbers, including a function to build a categorical structure from an array of pairs. Works with the Q.t type for rational numbers and custom data types wrapped with them. Used to construct probabilistic models where each element is associated with a rational weight.

Combines monadic operations for context-aware computation with rational number handling, enabling structured effectful workflows and weighted probabilistic modeling. Supports chaining of operations through monadic binds and lifts, and constructs categorical structures from arrays of rational pairs. Key types include parameterized monadic contexts and Q.t for rational numbers. Can be used to implement stateful transformations or probabilistic reasoning with weighted elements.

The module offers functions for calculating probability density and log-probability densities across diverse statistical distributions, including univariate and multivariate forms like Gaussian, Poisson, and gamma, along with tools for combining independent variables and mixture models. It processes numerical parameters, arrays, and tuples, leveraging log-space representations to ensure numerical stability in computations. Use cases include probabilistic modeling, Bayesian inference, and scenarios requiring multi-dimensional density evaluations or handling complex distribution combinations.

Provides single-site Metropolis-Hastings sampling with incremental updates, supporting distributions defined as OCaml functions. Operates on probability distributions and random variables represented as typed expressions. Enables Bayesian inference for models where parameter updates can be localized to individual variables.

combines monadic computation with rational numbers and statistical density functions, enabling structured effectful workflows and probabilistic modeling. It supports categorical constructions from rational pairs, stateful transformations, and density evaluations across various distributions. Operations include monadic binds, probability calculations, and log-space numerical processing. Examples include building weighted probabilistic models and performing Bayesian inference with complex distribution combinations.
